meanings.definition: The natural agent that stimulates sight and makes things visible.
meanings.sent1: The soft light of the moon illuminated the path through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with light from the bright morning sun.
meanings.sent3: Why did the light refuse to play hide and seek? Because it always shines!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a light in the darkness, bringing warmth and joy to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse beam cut through the fog, guiding ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: The brightness that comes from the sun, fire, or a lamp.
meanings.sent1: The flickering light of the campfire danced in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: She turned on the light to brighten up the room.
meanings.sent3: Why did the light bulb go to school? To get brighter!
meanings.sent4: The light of dawn painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The streetlights cast a warm glow on the quiet street.

meanings.sent1: She used a flashlight to light up the dark basement.
meanings.sent2: The candles were lit to light the room during the power outage.
meanings.sent3: Why did the matchstick break up with the candle? It couldn't handle the flame!
meanings.sent4: His words were able to light up her face with a smile.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of color.

meanings.definition: Not heavy; easy to lift or carry.
meanings.sent1: The light bag was comfortable to carry on the hike.
meanings.sent2: She chose the lightest suitcase for her travels.
meanings.sent3: Why did the feather challenge the rock to a race? Because it was feeling light on its feet!
meanings.sent4: His heart felt light as a feather after he forgave his friend.
meanings.sent5: The balloon floated effortlessly in the light breeze.
